io.reinert.requestor.serialization.json

Class JsonObjectSerdes<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.reinert.requestor.serialization.json.JsonSerdes<T>
      • io.reinert.requestor.serialization.json.JsonObjectSerdes<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the object to serialize/deserialize.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deserializer<T>, Serdes<T>, Serializer<T>

    public abstract class JsonObjectSerdes<T>
extends JsonSerdes<T>
    Base class for all SerDes that manipulates serialized JSON objects.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

    • Method Detail

      • useSafeEval

        public boolean useSafeEval()
        Verifies if the deserializer should evaluate the response safely.

        If this method returns true, then the deserializer will evaluate the response using JsonUtils.safeEval(String), otherwise it will use JsonUtils.unsafeEval(String).

        If you are completely sure you'll will always receive safe contents, then you can override it to return false and you'll benefit a faster deserialization.

        The default implementation is true.

        Returns:
        true if you want to evaluate response safely, or false to evaluate unsafely

      • readJson

        context - Context of the deserialization

             JsonRecordWriter writer,

        Build a JSON using JsonRecordWriter. Later this JSON will be serialized using JSON#stringify.
        Parameters:
        t - The object to be serialized
        writer - The serializing JSON
        context - Context of the serialization

      • deserialize

        public <C extends Collection<T>> C deserialize(Class<C> collectionType,
                                      String response,
                                      DeserializationContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Deserializer
        Deserialize the plain text into a collection T.

        The collection instance can be retrieved from its Provider, obtained in ProviderManager.get(java.lang.Class<T>).
        The ContainerFactoryManager can be retrieved from DeserializationContext.getInstance(Class).

        Parameters:
        collectionType - The class of the collection
        response - Http response body content
        context - Context of deserialization
        Returns:
        The object deserialized

      • isObject

        protected boolean isObject(String text)
        Checks if the serialized content is a JSON Object.
        Parameters:
        text - Serialized response
        Returns:
        true if argument is a JSON object, false otherwise

      • eval

        protected JavaScriptObject eval(String response)
        Performs evaluation of serialized response obeying the #useSafeEval configuration.

        If #useSafeEval is true then the eval is performed using JsonUtils.safeEval(java.lang.String), otherwise then content will be loosely evaluated by JsonUtils.unsafeEval(java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        response - The serialized content
        Returns:
        The converted JavaScriptObject
